articles.author: Bernard Orr
articles.description: After sealing pledges of a new era of strategic partnership with China's Xi Jinping, Russian President Vladimir Putin on Friday is set to highlight the growing importance of trade near the Russian border in China's northeast.
articles.title: Putin to push growing Moscow-Beijing trade in China's northeast

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli forces battled Hamas fighters in the narrow alleyways of Jabalia in northern Gaza on Friday in some of the fiercest engagements since they returned to the area a week ago, while in the south militants attacked tanks massing around Rafah.
articles.title: Fierce fighting in northern Gaza as Israel defends itself at World Court

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israel on Friday defended the military necessity of its Gaza offensive at the International Court of Justice after South Africa asked judges to order it to halt operations in Rafah and completely withdraw from the Palestinian territory.
articles.title: Israel tells World Court South Africa case makes a mockery of genocide

articles.author: Ayhan Uyanik, Jan Lopatka
articles.description: Slovak doctors will meet on Monday to assess Prime Minister Robert Fico's health and discuss the possibility of transporting him from Banska Bystrica to the capital Bratislava, local media reported on Friday.
articles.title: Slovak doctors to discuss moving PM Fico to Bratislava on Monday, reports say

articles.author: Alvise Armellini
articles.description: The Vatican issued new guidelines on Friday recommending a cautious approach to supposed supernatural events such as weeping Madonnas and blood-dripping crucifixes that have for centuries whipped up the Catholic faithful.
articles.title: Vatican urges caution over weeping Madonnas and other supposed apparitions

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The U.S. Central Command said on Friday that trucks carrying humanitarian assistance began moving ashore via a temporary pier in Gaza at 9 a.m. local time (0600 GMT).
articles.title: Aid trucks begin moving ashore via Gaza pier, US says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A top Russian diplomat said on Friday the United States had long since entered into a state of indirect war with Moscow and was playing with fire over Ukraine by behaving in such a way that the situation could spin out of control.
articles.title: Russia says US 'playing with fire' in 'indirect war' with Moscow

articles.author: Kirsty Needham, Camille Raynaud
articles.description: French police reinforcements have started arriving in New Caledonia as part of a massive operation to regain control of the capital Noumea, the top French official in the Pacific island territory said on Friday.
articles.title: 'Massive' French police deployment arrives to secure New Caledonia

articles.author: Ben Blanchard, Fabian Hamacher
articles.description: Taiwanese lawmakers shoved, tackled and hit each other in parliament on Friday in a bitter dispute about reforms to the chamber, just days before President-elect Lai Ching-te takes office without a legislative majority.
articles.title: Taiwan lawmakers exchange blows in bitter dispute over parliament reforms

articles.author: Gram Slattery, Sarah N. Lynch, Andrew Goudsward
articles.description: Some of Donald Trump's allies are assembling proposals to curtail the Justice Department's independence and turn the nation's top law enforcement body into an attack dog for conservative causes, nine people involved in the effort told Reuters.
articles.title: Insight: Donald Trump wants to control the Justice Department and FBI. His allies have a plan
